title: Travis Scott ‘breaks his knee’ at Rolling Loud festival
text:
Poor Travis carried on like a trooper (Picture: Getty; Be-at.tv)

Travis Scott didn’t let a little injury hamper his performance at Rolling Loud festival this weekend and refused to cancel the show despite thinking he ‘broke’ his knee after a nasty fall.

The SICKOMODE rapper quite literally hit the stage at Citi Field in New York on Saturday night, when he fell while performing Butterfly Effect.

In footage shot by a concert-goer, Travis is seen bending over and holding his leg while saying: ‘I ain’t going to lie, I think I just broke my knee right now. But this show cannot stop.’

He then told the audience to ‘put [their] middle fingers to the sky’ before launching into his next song No Bystanders.

What a trooper.

Snoop Dogg seemed to appreciate Travis’ efforts in continuing with the show, as he commented on a photo of the rapper’s Rolling Loud performance: ‘Can’t stop want stop love u for keeping ya fans entertained.’

Travis is believed to be working on his next album following the unstoppable success of his last release, ASTROWORLD, which spent several weeks at number one on the Billboard 200 chart.

Travis Scott legitimately believes he broke his knee right now at Rolling Loud but refuses to let the show stop 🥺

pic.twitter.com/CTRGbb1jfv — LA FLAME FANPAGE 🎠 (@bathingrage) October 13, 2019

It’s business as usual for Travis, 28, following his split from girlfriend Kylie Jenner this month.

The chart-topping rapper split from the cosmetics mogul after two years of dating, much to everyone’s surprise due to their recently loved-up displays.

Despite the end of their romance, Travis and Kylie, 22, are amicably co-parenting their one-year-old daughter Stormi and he recently revealed his joy at parenting the adorable tot.

‘Stormi is like a battery. I’ve gotten so much energy from her. She has shown me so many things that I never understood. I only got it once she was here,’ Travis told GQ Germany.

‘Fatherhood is the most impactful thing in my life.

‘To see your daughter getting a little older every day is the most magical experience in the world. I’ve also developed so much passion. I feel things I never felt before.’

Erm, anyone else getting all the feels?
